meanings.definition: The basic unit of currency in Israel.
meanings.sent1: In Israel, you can use lirot to buy things.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for lirot at the bank.
meanings.sent3: The piggy bank was full of shiny lirot.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a handful of colorful lirot.
meanings.sent5: The sound of clinking lirot filled the market.

meanings.definition: A plural form of the currency unit 'lira'.
meanings.sent1: The shopkeeper counted the lirot in the cash register.
meanings.sent2: She received a stack of lirot as a gift.
meanings.sent3: The children played with fake lirot in their game.
meanings.sent4: The room was decorated with strings of lirot for the party.
meanings.sent5: The magician pulled a rabbit out of a hat filled with lirot.
